title.text: BOOK REVIEWS NATURAL LANGUAGE UNDERSTANDING AND LOGIC PROGRAMMING, IX: PROCEEDINGS OF THE SECOND INTERNATIONAL WORKSHOP Veronica Dahl and Patl'ick Saint-Dizier (eds.)

abstractContent.text: This volume contains 18 papers and the positions presented at two panel sessions.
The papers are rather heterogeneous and the editors have not classified them in anyway.
The collection shows clearly the fast proliferation of new logic grammars and Prolog dialects, which is perhaps a necessary stage fora relatively new domain.
